timeline.bodyText:
We should disband from unquantified phrases "simple" or "easy-to-use." To Amazon-ify such statements, we could corroborate the in terms of # of steps to get started -- or # of lines of code to get started, etc. The user can then decide for themselves whether or not it is easy (hopefully.)

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              Interact with your GraphQL server or AWS AppSync API with an easy-to-use &
          
          
            
              configured GraphQL client.
          
          
            
              Designed for interaction with your GraphQL server or AWS AppSync API

timeline.bodyText: Should we instead include a note about setting up Auth, before API and DataStore will work? It could still be a worthwhile call out. The use of a disparate library to do auth was a surprise in preview. The need to use Auth is less of a surprise, but still not immediately obvious to a new comer, I'd suppose.
